fxInfo_citation: Bernhard et al. (2015, V-Dem Working Paper Series 2015:13); Pemstein et al. (2018, V-Dem Working Paper Series 2018:21); V-Dem Codebook (see suggested citation at the top of this document).
fxInfo_cross_coder_aggregation: Bayesian Item Response Theory Measurement Model
fxInfo_question: Are major civil society organizations (CSOs) routinely consulted by policymakers on policies relevant to their members?

fxInfo_responses.value: No. There is a high degree of insulation of the government from CSO input. The government may sometimes enlist or mobilize CSOs after policies are adopted to sell them to the public at large. But it does not often consult with them in formulating policies.
To some degree. CSOs are but one set of voices that policymakers sometimes take into account.

Yes. Important CSOs are recognized as stakeholders in important policy areas and given voice on such issues. This can be accomplished through formal corporatist arrangements or through less formal arrangements.

fxInfo_scale: Ordinal, converted to interval by the measurement model
name: v2cscnsult, *_osp, *_ord
